intro: Triopterys brachypteris, commonly known as the short-winged triopterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. It produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Triopterys brachypteris is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is valued for its ornamental foliage.
